analyzed: anya padārthaḥ soma dravyam

translated: Or the sacrifice accomplished by that.

analyzed: ubhayathā api kādācitkatva abhāvāt bahuvrīhi anta pada vaiyarthya āpatteḥ aindra vāyava agra tva śukra agra tvayoḥ vikalpa āpatteḥ ca na tatra api tad anvayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: In both cases, because there is no occasionality, there is the undesirable consequence of the uselessness of the compound ending with bahuvrihi, and because of the undesirable consequence of the option between being the first of Indra and Vayu and being the first of Shukra, the relation of that is not there also. This is the meaning.

original: ayogavyāvṛttyānyayogavyāvṛttyā vā krato rathantaraviśeṣaṇatvāsaṃbhavāt viśiṣṭanimittatvapakṣena rathantaranimittatvam

analyzed: na api viśiṣṭaḥ iti
translated: Nor is it qualified.

analyzed: viśiṣṭe tad anvaya pakṣe kim anya padārthaḥ viśeṣaṇam viśeṣyam vā  na ādyaḥ saptamī viśeṣaṇe bahuvrīhau iti sūtreṇa rathantara śabdasya pūrvanipātena viśeṣaṇa tva pratīteḥ viśeṣya tva ayogena vyutpatti bhaṅga āpatteḥ

Because of the sūtra In the locative, the bahuvrīhi [Pāṇini 2.1.50], the word Rathantara is placed first, so it is understood to be a qualifier, and it cannot be a qualified, so the derivation would be broken.

original: naca vigrahavelāyāmanyapadārthasya kratoḥ ṣaṣṭhyantatvena viśeṣaṇatvasya rathantarasya prathamāntatvena viśeṣyatvasya ca pratītervaiśiṣṭyasaṃbhava
analyzed: naca vigraha velāyām anya padārthasya kratoḥ ṣaṣṭhī anta tvena viśeṣaṇa tvasya rathantarasya prathamā anta tvena viśeṣya tvasya ca pratīteḥ vaiśiṣṭya saṃbhava
translated: And it cannot be said that at the time of analysis, because the meaning of the other word, the sacrifice, is in the genitive case, it is a qualifier, and because the Rathantara is in the nominative case, it is a qualified, so the qualified is possible.

analyzed: iti vācyam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: vigraha vākyasya avaidika tayā tad upātta viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvena nimitta tva anvaya anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the sentence of analysis is not Vedic, the inherence of the qualifier and qualified it contains cannot be the cause of the inherence of the cause.

original: grahāgratānimittabhūte rathantare prakaraṇādeva kratumattvasiddheḥ svāyogavyāvṛttyā kratorviśeṣaṇatvasya vaiyarthyācca /

translated: Since the Rathantara, being the cause of the preeminence of the grahas, is established as having a sacrifice by the context itself, and since the qualification of the sacrifice by the exclusion of its non-application is useless.

original: kratvantarayogavyāvṛttyā viśeṣaṇatvasyopadeśena tadvyāvṛtteḥ pramāṇābhāvādeva siddhatvena vaiyarthyācca /

translated: And since the qualification by the exclusion of its connection with another sacrifice is established by the injunction itself, and since the exclusion of that by the injunction is not established by any other means of knowledge, it is useless.

original: atideśena tadvyāvṛttestavāpyaniṣṭatvācceti kratorviśeṣaṇatvapakṣamayuktaṃ matvā saṃbhavaduktikaṃ dvitīyaṃ pakṣaṃ nirasyati jyotiṣṭoma 🔽iti //🔽rathantaramātrasādhanatvavidhāne vākyāpatteḥ viṣamaśiṣṭavikalpāyogena tadanaṅgīkāreṇāpi nimittatvānupapatteśca karmabhedasyaiva mukhyatvam
analyzed: atideśena tad vyāvṛtteḥ tava api aniṣṭa tvāt ca iti kratoḥ viśeṣaṇa tva pakṣam ayuktam matvā saṃbhavat uktikam dvitīyam pakṣam nirasyati  / iti  rathantara mātra sādhanatva vidhāne vākya āpatteḥ viṣama śiṣṭa vikalpa ayogena tad anaṅgīkāreṇa api nimitta tva anupapatteḥ ca karma bhedasya eva mukhya tvam
translated: And since the exclusion of that by the extension is undesirable even for you, considering the position of the qualification of the sacrifice to be improper, he rejects the second position which is possible to state, with the words of the Jyotiṣṭoma.🔽If the Rathantara alone were enjoined as the means, there would be a split of the sentence, and since the option of the different remnants is not possible, even without accepting it, the non-applicability of the cause is established, and therefore the difference of the action is primary.

original: gāyatryādīnāṃ sāmāntarāṇāmapi stotrāntarasaṃbandhitayā jyotiṣṭome viśiṣya vihitatvena tadvyāvṛttyā rathantarāderviśeṣaṇatvānupapattirityarthaḥ

translated: The meaning is that the qualification of the Rathantara etc. by the exclusion of that is not possible, since the Gāyatrī etc. and other Sāmans are specifically enjoined in the Jyotiṣṭoma in connection with other stotras.

analyzed: jyotiṣṭoma tva avacchedena iti
translated: Within the specification of the Jyotiṣṭoma.

original: śaṅkhaḥ pāṇḍura evetyādau pāṇḍuratvāderviśeṣyatāvacchedakāvacchedena svāyogavyāvṛttyā viśeṣaṇatvasya dṛṣṭatve 'pi prakṛte tadasaṃbhavaḥ /

translated: In the case of the statement the conch is white, although the whiteness etc. is seen to be the qualifier by the exclusion of its own non-connection by the delimitation by the qualifier-determiner, in the present case that is not possible.

analyzed: athavā pati anta purohita ādibhyaḥ yak iti sūtreṇa purohita ādi gaṇa paṭhita tvena
translated: Or, by the sūtra Yak for offspring, priest etc. it is included in the priest etc. group.

analyzed: tasmāt yak pratyayena vā rāja śabdasya brāhmaṇa śabda vat prajā pālana kāri vāci tva anavagamāt siddha vat nirdeśena
translated: Therefore, like the word brāhmaṇa, the word rāja does not convey the meaning of one who protects the people, by the suffix yak. Hence, by the statement as if it were established,

analyzed: jāti vāci tā eva adhyavasīyate
translated: the denotation of a class is ascertained.

original: tataśca durbalaprasiddherapi prabalavyākaraṇasmṛtyupaṣṭabdhatvena prābalyopapatterjātivācitvameva yuktamityata āha vyākaraṇeti //
analyzed: tatas ca durbala prasiddheḥ api prabala vyākaraṇa smṛti upaṣṭabdha tvena prābalya upapatteḥ jāti vāci tvam eva yuktam iti atas āha vyākaraṇa iti
translated: And from that, even the weak well-known meaning is capable of being stronger, being supported by the strong Smṛti of grammar. Therefore, the denotation of a class is proper. Hence he says in grammar etc.

analyzed: vyākaraṇa smṛteḥ sādhu tva anvākhyāna mātra tvena śakti grahe pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no evidence for grasping the power [of words] by the mere explanation of correctness in the Smṛti of grammar.

original: tattvepivā prajāpālanakartuḥ rājño yat prajāpālanarūpaṃ karma tat rājyamityarthe
analyzed: prajā pālana kartuḥ rājñaḥ yat prajā pālana rūpam karma tat rājyam iti arthe
translated: Or, even if that is so, the action in the form of protecting the people of the king who is the protector of the people, that is called rājya in the sense of that is his action.

original: rājyaśabdavyutpattāvapi rājaśabdasya prajāpālanakartṛvācitvānivāraṇāt tasyā api draviḍaprasiddhimūlakatayā🔽niyāmakatvānupapattiḥ /🔽nacaitāvatā rājyaśabdaśaktigrahaṇasya rājaśabdavyutpattigrahasāpekṣatvam /
analyzed: rājya śabda vyutpattau api rāja śabdasya prajā pālana kartṛ vāci tva a nivāraṇāt tasyāḥ api draviḍa prasiddhi mūlaka tayā          na ca etāvatā rājya śabda śakti grahaṇasya rāja śabda vyutpatti graha sāpekṣa tvam
translated: Even in the derivation of the word 'rājya', the word 'rāja' is not excluded from denoting the protector of the people, so that also cannot be the determiner, being based on the Dravidian usage.🔽And by this much, the understanding of the meaning of the word 'rājya' is not dependent on the understanding of the derivation of the word 'rāja'.

analyzed: rāja karma tvena ābodhe pi prajā pālana tvena buddhasya eva tasya śakyatā avacchedaka tva upapatteḥ
translated: Even without understanding it as the action of the king, it is possible for the king to be the qualifier of the meaning of 'rājya' by being the protector of the people.

analyzed: kiñca sārvalaukika prasiddheḥ api na rājñaḥ pratigṛhṇīyāt arājanya prasūtinaḥ
translated: Moreover, the king should not accept gifts from a non-Kṣatriya-born person,

original: na śūdrarājye vasedi tyādismṛtyupaṣṭabdhatvānna kevalaṃ prasiddhereva kṣatriyasya tadbodhyatvam /
analyzed: na śūdra rājye vaset ityādi smṛti upaṣṭabdha tvāt na kevalam prasiddheḥ eva kṣatriyasya tad bodhya tvam
translated: and he should not dwell in a kingdom ruled by a Śūdra. By being supported by such Smṛti texts, the Kṣatriya is to be understood, not merely by the common usage.

analyzed: etena kṣatriyasya eva prajā pālanam paramaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: By this, the protection of the people is the highest duty of the Kṣatriya only.

analyzed: rājā sarvasya iṣṭe brāhmaṇam ityādi manu ādi smṛtīnām api tad upaṣṭambhaka tvāt iti nirastam
translated: The Smṛti texts of Manu and others, such as 'the king is the desired one of all, he is the Brāhmaṇa', also support that. This is refuted.

original: tāsāṃ kṣatriyamātroddeśena pālanāvaśyakatāvidhāyakatve 'pi rāgādinā brāhmaṇādāvapi pālayitṛtvasaṃbhavāt /
analyzed: tāsām kṣatriya mātra uddeśena pālana āvaśyaka tā vidhāyaka tve pi rāga ādinā brāhmaṇa ādau api pālayitṛ tva saṃbhavāt
translated: Even though they enjoin the necessity of protecting only the Kshatriyas, since it is possible for one to protect even Brahmins etc. out of affection etc.,

analyzed: atas na āsām upaṣṭambhaka tvam iti arthaḥ
translated: therefore they do not support it, is the meaning.

original: pratyutāryāvartaprayoga eva viśeṣataḥ śrutyupaṣṭabdha ityāha sarvaloketi //
analyzed: pratyuta āryāvarta prayogaḥ eva viśeṣataḥ śruti upaṣṭabdhaḥ iti āha sarva loka iti
translated: On the contrary, the application of the Arya-varta is especially supported by the Veda, he says 'sarva-loka' etc.

analyzed: prajā pālana kartṛ tva aviśeṣe api upanaya ādhāna vidhi siddha agni vidyayoḥ abhāvena śūdrasya vyāvṛttau api
translated: Even though there is no difference in the duty of protecting the people, the Shudra is excluded because he does not have the knowledge of the fire established by the injunctions of Upanayana and initiation,

analyzed: traivarṇikānām rājasūye dhikārasya avyāhata tvāt tad antargatau eṣṭau api teṣām adhikārāt
translated: but since the right of the three varnas to the Rajasuya is unobstructed, and since they have the right to the Avesti also which is included in it,

original: brāhmaṇādīnāṃ kartṛtvena prāpteḥ rājanyavākye 'niyamenaiva rājñaḥ kartṛtayā prāpternimittatvasyaivāśrayaṇāt
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādīnām kartṛ tvena prāpteḥ rājanya vākye niyamena eva rājñaḥ kartṛ tayā prāpteḥ nimitta tvasya eva āśrayaṇāt
translated: and since the Brahmins etc. are entitled as performers, and since the king is entitled as the performer by the Rājan-vākyas without any restriction, and since only the cause is accepted,

analyzed: tad sāhacaryāt iha api brāhmaṇa ādi vākyayoḥ api nimitta tvam eva yuktam iti abhipretya pūrvapakṣa upasaṃhāra vyājena
translated: thinking that it is proper that even in these Brahmana etc. statements, only the cause should be accepted, under the pretext of concluding the prima facie view,

original: pūrvapakṣe naimittikaṃ vidheyavivekaṃ darśayati ata iti //
analyzed: pūrvapakṣe naimittikam vidheya vivekam darśayati atas iti
translated: he shows the distinction of the occasional from the enjoined in the prima facie view, with 'ataḥ' etc.

original: pūrvottarapakṣayoḥ prayogabhede satyapi pūrvapakṣe pañcahaviṣkaikaprayogo rājasūyāntargata iti nirūpaṇam
analyzed: pūrva uttarapakṣayoḥ prayoga bhede sati api pūrvapakṣe pañca haviṣka eka prayogaḥ rājasūya antargataḥ iti nirūpaṇam
translated: Although there is a difference in the application of the prima facie view and the final view, in the prima facie view it is determined that the five-oblation-offering is included in the Rajasuya sacrifice.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ na atra abhighāraṇa mātram naimittika tayā vidhīyate
translated: The meaning is: here the sprinkling alone is not enjoined as a contingent rite.

analyzed: madhye nidhāna anuvāda asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because it is not possible to restate the placing in the middle.

analyzed: atas madhye nidhāna viśiṣṭa abhighāraṇasya pañca haviṣka eka iṣṭi prayogam vinā anupapadyamānasya ekaika haviṣka eka iṣṭi prayogeṣu aniveśāt madhye
translated: Therefore, the sprinkling qualified by the placing in the middle, which is not possible without the single-offering-performance with five oblations, is not included in the single-offering-performances with one oblation each. Therefore,

analyzed: nidhāna rūpa viśeṣaṇa sāmarthyāt tad viśiṣṭa abhighāraṇasya prayoga antara ākṣepaka tvam
translated: by the power of the qualification in the form of the placing in the middle, the sprinkling qualified by that implies another performance.

original: tataśca pūrvottarapakṣayoḥ prayogāntarākṣepakatve tulye 'pi nimittārthatvapakṣe rājasūyāntargato 'pi naimittikaḥ pañcahaviṣkaikeṣṭiprayogaḥ
analyzed: tatas ca pūrva uttara pakṣayoḥ prayoga antara ākṣepaka tve tulye pi nimitta artha tva pakṣe rājasūya antargataḥ u pi naimittikaḥ pañca haviṣka eka iṣṭi prayogaḥ
translated: And thus, although the implication of another performance is the same in both the prima facie view and the final view, in the view that it is for the purpose of an occasion, the single-offering-performance with five oblations, which is contingent, is included in the Rajasuya.

analyzed: sidhyati
translated: It is accomplished.

original: vidhāyakatvapakṣetu rājasūyādbahireva tādṛśaṃ prayogāntaramiti prayojanabhedo 'nusandheyaḥ iti /
analyzed: vidhāyaka tva pakṣe tu rājasūyāt bahis eva tādṛśam prayoga antaram iti prayojana bhedaḥ nusandheyaḥ iti
translated: But in the view that it is an injunction, such another performance is outside the Rajasuya itself. Thus the difference in purpose should be understood.

original: kva tarhi nimittārthatvapakṣe rājasūyāntargatānāṃ pratyekaprayogāṇāṃ niveśa ityapekṣāyāmāha pratyeketi //
analyzed: kva tarhi nimitta artha tva pakṣe rājasūya antargatānām pratyeka prayogāṇām niveśaḥ iti apekṣāyām āha pratyeka iti
translated: Then, in the case of taking the subsidiaries as having the purpose of the archetype, where should the individual rites included in the Rajasuya be placed? Anticipating this question, he says 'each' etc.

analyzed: anulomānām tad tad pitṛ gata jātimat tva abhāve tad tad mātṛ gata jāti sadbhāvasya tad tad smṛtiṣu ukteḥ brāhmaṇāt
translated: Even in the absence of the quality belonging to each father in the case of the Anuloma offspring, the existence of the quality belonging to each mother is stated in the respective Smritis.

original: kṣatriyāyāmutpannasya rājatvajātimattvena rājasūye 'dhikārāt tadviṣayāḥ pratyekaprayogā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: kṣatriyāyām utpannasya rāja tva jātimat tvena rājasūye dhikārāt tad viṣayāḥ pratyeka prayogāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, one born from a Brahmana and a Kshatriya woman has the quality of kingship and is entitled to the Rajasuya. The meaning is that there are individual rites pertaining to that.

original: yadātu tasyāpi yadi rājanyamiti vākyena pañcahaviṣṭvaikeṣṭiprayogasyaiva prāpterna pratyekaprayogāṇāṃ niveśa ityālocyate /
analyzed: yadā tu tasya api yadi rājanyam iti vākyena pañca haviṣṭvā eka iṣṭi prayogasya eva prāpteḥ na pratyeka prayogāṇām niveśaḥ iti ālocyate
translated: But if it is considered that by the sentence 'if he is a Kshatriya' etc., only the performance of the Pañcahaviṣ sacrifice is obtained, and there is no placement of the individual rites,

original: tadā pratyekaprayogāṇāmapyanavakāśatayā bādhāsaṃbhavāt tattatkartṛbhisteṣāmapi samuccayenānuṣṭhānamiti draṣṭavyamiti bodhyamitipadena sūcitam
analyzed: tadā pratyeka prayogāṇām api anavakāśa tayā bādhā asaṃbhavāt tad tad kartṛbhiḥ teṣām api samuccayena anuṣṭhānam iti draṣṭavyam iti bodhyam iti padena sūcitam
translated: then it should be understood that by the word 'iti' it is indicated that even the individual rites should be performed collectively by those performers, because they cannot be contradicted due to lack of opportunity.

original: etayānnādyakāmaṃ yājayedityanena prayogadvayasyāpi bahiḥ phalārthaṃ vidhānam
analyzed: etayā annādya kāmam yājayet iti anena prayoga dvayasya api bahis phala artham vidhānam
translated: By this, both the performance and the injunction of the fruit outside are stated by the text 'one desiring food should be sacrificed to'.

original: nanu evametayā annādyakāmaṃ yājayediti vidherannādyārthatvenāpi prayogāntarāpattirityata āha etayeti //
analyzed: nanu evam etayā annādya kāmam yājayet iti vidheḥ annādya artha tvena api prayoga antara āpattiḥ iti atas āha etayā iti
translated: But in that case, the injunction one should sacrifice with this for one desiring food would also apply to another performance, as it is for the purpose of food. To this he says by this.

original: asmiṃśca vākye prayogānvayiguṇāntarābhāvena tadbhedāprasakteḥ kartrapekṣāyāṃ rājasūyavākyagatāveṣṭikartṛkṣatriyeṇaiva
analyzed: asmin ca vākye prayoga anvayi guṇa antara abhāvena tad bheda aprasakteḥ kartṛ apekṣāyām rājasūya vākya gatau iṣṭi kartṛ kṣatriyeṇa eva
translated: And in this sentence, due to the absence of other qualities that are related to the performance, the possibility of difference is not relevant. When there is a need for an agent, by the Kshatriya agent mentioned in the Rajasuya sentence,

analyzed: nairākāṅkṣyāt tasya eva upasthita tvāt kartṛ tvena anvaya upapatteḥ viniyoga anvayi guṇa sattvena āveṣṭi mātrasya eva
translated: due to the absence of expectation, since he alone is present, the connection as an agent is logically possible. When there are qualities related to the application, only the Avesti

analyzed: viniyoga antara mātram kriyate
translated: is applied to another application.

original: evañca yugapatprayoge ca yogasidhyadhikaraṇanyāyenānekaphalajananāyogāt bahirapi tattatprayogāṇāmannādyārthamanuṣṭhānamityarthaḥ //🔽draviḍaprasiddherapi śrutismṛtyanugṛhītāyāḥ prāmāṇyena jātimata evātra vivakṣiteti siddhāntopakramaḥ
analyzed: evam ca yugapad prayoge ca yoga sidhi adhikaraṇa nyāyena aneka phala janana ayogāt bahis api tad tad prayogāṇām annādya artham anuṣṭhānam iti arthaḥ  draviḍa prasiddheḥ api śruti smṛti anugṛhītāyāḥ prāmāṇyena jātimataḥ eva atra vivakṣitā iti siddhānta upakramaḥ
translated: And thus, in the simultaneous performance, due to the impossibility of producing many fruits according to the principle of the Yogasiddhyadhikaranam, even externally, the performance of each of those performances is for the purpose of food. This is the meaning.

analyzed: smṛteḥ prasiddhi dvaya upi anugrāhaka tva sāmye pi draviḍa prasiddheḥ sakala pramāṇa mūrdhanya śruti anugrāhya tvāt
translated: The conclusion is that even though both types of well-known practices are equally supportive of the Smriti, the Dravida well-known practice is supported by the Shruti, which is the foremost of all means of knowledge,

original: prāmāṇye viśvasanīyataratvopapādanena siddhāntaṃ sādhayati rājānamiti //🔽abhiṣeke hi pālanādhikārasaṃpādakatvenaiva vidheyatvādityarthaḥ //
analyzed: prāmāṇye viśvasanīyatara tva upapādanena siddhāntam sādhayati rājānam iti  abhiṣeke hi pālana adhikāra saṃpādaka tvena eva vidheya tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: In order to establish the conclusion by explaining the greater reliability in the case of authoritativeness, he says the king etc.🔽The meaning is that in an installation, it is to be enjoined only as accomplishing the authority to rule.

original: idānīṃ rājyaśabdasya yakpratyayāntatvenānuśāsanāttataḥ pūrvaṃ rājaprakṛtyarthanirṇayāvaśyakatayāpi draviḍaprasiddheḥ smṛtyupaṣṭabdhatvamapītyāha
analyzed: idānīm rājya śabdasya yak pratyaya anta tvena anuśāsanāt tatas pūrvam rāja prakṛti artha nirṇaya āvaśyaka tayā api draviḍa prasiddheḥ smṛti upaṣṭabdha tvam api iti āha
translated: Now, since the meaning of the root is to be determined before the rule that the word rājya ends with the suffix yak, he says that the Smṛti is supported by the Dravidian usage.

analyzed: tasya karmaṇi iti
translated: He says his two actions etc.

analyzed: rājyāya eva iti śrutau pratyaya stha ākārasya udātta tva śravaṇa upapatti artham yak antasya eva yukta tva nirūpaṇam
translated: In order to explain the propriety of the suffix yak alone, in order to make it possible to hear the accent on the vowel a in the suffix in the Vedic text rājyaivābhíṣicyante, he says rājyaivābhíṣicyante.

original: yadyapyatra ṣyañyaganyatarapratyayenāpi rājyaśabdavyutpattiḥ samānā /🔽tathāpi loke viśeṣābhāve 'pi rājyāyaivetyabhiṣicyante rājetyetānabhiṣiktānācakṣate
analyzed: yadi api atra rājya śabda vyutpattiḥ samānā  tathā api loke viśeṣa abhāve pi rājyāya eva iti abhiṣicyante rājā iti etān abhiṣiktān ācakṣate
translated: Although the derivation of the word rājya is the same with either the suffix kvip or yak,

analyzed: ityādi śrutau rājya śabda gata pratyaya stha ākārasya udātta svara tva upalaṃbhāt yak pratyaya anta tā eva yuktā
translated: nevertheless, in the Vedic text rājyaivābhíṣicyante, rājā eva abhíṣicyante, rājā eva te 'bhiṣikta ācakṣate etc., since the accent on the vowel a in the suffix in the word rājya is heard, it is proper that it should end with the suffix yak.

original: tadāhikarṣātvato ghaño 'nta udātta iti sūtrādanta ityanuvartamāne taddhitasyeticānuvartamāne🔽kita ityanena yakārākārasyādyantavadekasminnityekavadbhāvenodāttatvavidhānāt yakārāntatvena
analyzed: tadā ahi karṣa ātvataḥ ghañaḥ ntaḥ udāttaḥ iti sūtrāt antaḥ iti anuvartamāne taddhitasya iti ca anuvartamāne  k itaḥ iti anena yakāra ākārasya ādi anta vat ekasmin iti ekavat bhāvena udātta tva vidhānāt yakāra anta tvena
translated: Therefore, from the sutra The final vowel of a noun ending in a k, gh, or j is acute, the word final is continued, and the word of a secondary derivative is also continued.

analyzed: pratyaya udātta tvam labhyate  ṣya ñ anta tve tu ñ nitya ādiḥ nityam iti anena ādi udātta vidhānāt prakṛti stha repha ākāra udātta tvam
translated: Since the rule of acute accent on the first syllable is applied by the word kiti to the y and a forms as if they were at the beginning and end, the accent on the final y is obtained.🔽But if it ends in ṣyañ, the rule of acute accent on the first syllable by the word nitya etc. would cause the acute accent on the r and a in their original positions.

analyzed: syāt iti nyāyasudhā upapāditam yak anta tva niścayam abhipretya pati anta purohita ādibhyaḥ iti eva upanyastam
translated: Therefore, with the intention of ascertaining that it ends in ya, as explained in the Nyāyasudhā, it is presented as from paty-anta, purohita, etc..

analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādi kartṛka prayoga antara vidhānam iti tasya bahis kratu anuṣṭhāna ādi nirūpaṇam
translated: The prescription of other usages by Brahmins and others; the description of their external ritual performance etc.

analyzed: vacane eva iti
translated: Only in the statement.

analyzed: tathā ācārya āvarta prayogaḥ tu rāja kārya kāri tva guṇa yogena gauṇaḥ iti eva kāreṇa sūcitam
translated: Thus, the usage in Āryāvarta is indicated by the word eva as being secondary due to the quality of performing royal duties.

analyzed: atas brāhmaṇa ādīnām kartṛ tvena aprāpteḥ nimitta tva ayogena vidheya tva āvaśyaka tvāt prāpta yāga anuvādena
translated: Therefore, since Brahmins and others are not entitled as agents, and since it is necessary for them to be enjoined due to the impossibility of being the cause, by reiterating the obtained sacrifice,

analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādi kartṛ tva ādi rūpa aneka guṇa vidhau vākya bheda āpatteḥ brāhmaṇa ādi kartṛ tva rūpāt pūrvatra a niviśamānāt
translated: Or, in the injunction of many qualities such as being performed by Brahmins etc., there would be syntactical split, so it is understood that due to the quality in the form of being performed by Brahmins etc. not being included before,

original: guṇāt prayogabheda ityabhipretya siddhānte vidheyaṃ darśayati ataśceti //
analyzed: guṇāt prayoga bhedaḥ iti abhipretya siddhānte vidheyam darśayati atas ca iti
translated: there is a difference in application. With this in mind, in the conclusion, he shows what is to be enjoined with the word ataśca (therefore).

analyzed: prayoga antarasya ca dharmi grāhaka pramāṇa siddham rājasūya bahirbhāvam abhipretya bahiḥkratu iti uktam
translated: And because the external nature of the Rajasuya is established by the means of knowing the subject, it is said bahiḥ-kṛtva (with external rites).

original: tataśca brāhmaṇādiśravaṇānavicchinnā aveṣṭiprayogā bhinnā eva rājasūyāntargatā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca brāhmaṇa ādi śravaṇa anavicchinnāḥ aveṣṭi prayogāḥ bhinnāḥ eva rājasūya antargatāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the applications of the Avesti, which are not interrupted by the mention of Brahmins etc., are indeed different, included within the Rajasuya. This is the meaning.

original: bahiḥ kratvanuṣṭheyaprayogāntarasyaiva phalāpekṣāyāmapekṣitavidhitvalābhena 'etayā annādyakāma' mitivākyena phalasaṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: bahis kratu anuṣṭheya prayoga antarasya eva phala apekṣāyām apekṣita vidhi tva lābhena etayā annādya kāma miti vākyena phala saṃbandhaḥ
translated: When the application of the external rite to be performed has a need for a result, the connection with the result is by the sentence One desiring food by this, by obtaining the required injunctive nature.

analyzed: na tu rājasūya antargatasya  tasya svārājya phalena eva nirākāṅkṣa tvena anākāṅkṣita vidhi tva āpatteḥ iti abhipretya āha tasya ca iti

analyzed: kratu vidhīnām agni vidyā sādhya tvam

analyzed: agni vidyā sādhya tvāt iti

original: adhyayanañca vinā mantrādipāṭhāsaṃbhavāt vidyāsādhyatvamityarthaḥ //🔽kratuvidheradhyayanavidyayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvasya lokasiddhatvena vidyākṣepe 'pi alaukikāhavanīyasādhanādhānākṣepāsaṃbhavaśaṅkā
analyzed: adhyayanam ca vinā mantra ādi pāṭha asaṃbhavāt vidyā sādhya tvam iti arthaḥ  kratu vidheḥ adhyayana vidyayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvasya loka siddha tvena vidyā ākṣepe pi alaukika āhavanīya sādhana ādhāna ākṣepa asaṃbhava śaṅkā

analyzed: pi adṛṣṭa rūpa āhavanīya upāya tvasya anyatas nava gateḥ katham kratu vidhibhiḥ anaṅga bhūtasya adhā

analyzed: nasya ākṣepaḥ iti atas āha agneḥ ca iti

analyzed: atra vidheya antara abhāvāt ādhānasya eva vidhiḥ

translated: But in the sentences of the Brahmanas etc., when the injunction of the quality of spring etc. is possible, it is not proper to assume an injunction of the qualified. This is the meaning.

analyzed: evañca yaḥ evam vidvān iti vidvat tā anuvādasya api kratu vidhi ākṣipta vidvat tayā eva upapatteḥ vidvat vākyena upāya tayā ādhānasya avagatasya
translated: And thus, because the statement of knowledge in one who knows thus is also possible only with the knowledge implied by the injunction of the sacrifice, and because the setting up of the sacred fires is understood as the means by the sentence about the one who knows,

translated: because it is implied by the injunctions of the sacrifice itself, and because it is obtained as common to all four varnas, the mention of Brahmanas etc. is for the purpose of the occasion.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa kartṛka tve nimitte kevala ādhāna uddeśena nimitta anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi adhikaraṇa tāka tvena kāla vidhiḥ

analyzed: na ca yadi śabda abhāve nimitta tva bodha asaṃbhavaḥ

analyzed: sva rūpeṇa prāptasya nimitta tvena eva anvetum yogyatayā tena rūpeṇa yadiśabda abhāve pi anvaya upapatteḥ iti abhipretya āha nimitta artham śravaṇam iti

analyzed: tatas ca tad uddeśena vasanta ādi kāla adhikaraṇa tā niyamaḥ vidhīyate iti arthaḥ  atas eva kālasya sandhyā vandana ādi vat nimitta adhīna anuṣṭhāna viṣaya tva rūpa naimittika tva asaṃbhave pi nimitta anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi adhikaraṇa tāka tvena eva

translated: Even though the establishment and initiation are the objects, there is no split of the sentence etc. in the injunction of the occasional, so it is said that the establishment is common to all.

translated: And therefore, since the laying of the sacred fires and the initiation are connected with a fixed time, being preceded by the Agnihotra and other rites, the restriction of the performer to the Brāhmaṇa and others can also be enjoined in the case of the time of spring etc., which is the occasion for the laying of the sacred fires and the initiation.

analyzed: yadi api saṃpratipanna devatāka tvena dvayoḥ āgneyayoḥ saha anuṣṭhānāt na āgneya dvaya karaṇa prasaktiḥ pūrava pakṣe
translated: Even though there is no need for performing two Agneya sacrifices in the case of the Purvapaksha, because of the performance together of the two Agneyas with the same accepted deity,

analyzed: tathā api punar vidhi vaiyarthya āpattyā eva saha anuṣṭhāna bādhāt
translated: nevertheless, because of the contradiction of the performance together by the very occurrence of the uselessness of the injunction,

analyzed: athavā puroḍāśa dvaya karaṇāt vā āgneya dvaya karaṇam abhipretya āha atas eva iti
translated: or else, thinking of the performance of two Agneyas because of the performance of two cakes, he says 'for this very reason'.

original: yadāgneya iti vākyāntareṇā'gneyasya kevalāgnidevatātvāvadhāraṇāt kathaṃ tenaindrāgnapraśaṃsetyapekṣāyāmāha praśasteti //
analyzed: yat āgneyaḥ iti vākya antareṇa āgneyasya kevala agni devatā tva avadhāraṇāt katham tena aindrāgna praśaṃsā iti apekṣāyām āha praśastā iti
translated: Since the sentence it is dedicated to Agni determines the mere deity of Agni for the Agneya, how can it praise the Indra-Agni? In anticipation of this question, it says praise.

original: aṅgiraso vā ita uttamāḥ svargaṃlokamāyanni tyādyarthavādasahitatadvidhinā āgneyaprāśastyāvagamāt praśastāgneyasāhityenaindrāgnapraśaṃsetyarthaḥ
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ vai itas uttamāḥ svargam lokam āyan ityādi arthavāda sahita tad vidhinā āgneya prāśastya avagamāt praśastā āgneya sāhityena aindrāgna praśaṃsā iti arthaḥ
translated: Since the excellence of the Agneya is understood from the injunction of that along with the explanatory passage beginning the Angirasas indeed went to the world of heaven, the meaning is that the Indra-Agni is praised by the association with the praised Agneya.

analyzed: pūrvapakṣe prayojanam amāvāsyāyām āgneya dvayasya tad saṃbandhi tvena aṣṭākapāla dvayasya karaṇam
translated: The purpose in the prima facie view is the performance of the two cakes on eight potsherds in connection with the two Agneya offerings on the new moon day.

analyzed: siddhānte na iti spaṣṭa tvāt na uktam  iti caturdaśam āgneya stuti artha tā adhikaraṇam
translated: In the established conclusion, it is not so. This is clear and hence not stated.🔽Thus ends the fourteenth chapter on the purpose of praising the Agneya.

analyzed: iti bhāṭṭa dīpikā prabhāvalyām dvitīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyā pādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third section of the second chapter in the Prabhavali commentary on the Bhattadipika.
